name: Inferno 2
description: Inferno 2 is an intense, atmospheric twin-stick adventure-shooter. Blast through 80+ levels full of enemies and secrets while upgrading your ship the way you want.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or greater Processor: 1.5GHz or higher Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 256MB DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 200 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or greater Processor: 2.0GHz or higher Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 512MB or higher DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 200 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Really solid and tight twin-stick action, with deviously crafted levels and RPG development mechanics. Anyone who's a fan of twin-stick shooters or action dungeon-crawlers owes it to themselves to play this.
Enjoyable twin-stick shooter, good controls, slightly easy on 'Hot', slightly samey weapons, but fun.

Great game, already working through the 'New Game+' mode.    I noticed 2 things though during the playthough. 1. The portal locations I don't believe were explained and their usage isn't consistent on every level (the direction you enter from determines the way you exit, usually). Secondly, For some reason I can't select various upgrades (like Armor) on the upgrade panel. Given it's a prerelease its awesome.
